class src.datagather.changedfiles.ChangedFiles¶

Bases: DataGather

A class to gather and process changed files, inheriting from DataGather.

Attributes:

  • fileListList (list): List of lists containing changed files.

  • logger (Logger): Logger instance for logging information.

Methods:

  • gather(): Gathers changed files and filters out new files.

  • return_data(): Returns a dictionary with the changed files and their diffs.

  • pretty_print(): Returns a formatted string of the changed files and their diffs.

  • process_data(): Processes the gathered data to filter out noise and whitelist files.

fileListList = []¶
file_diff = <module 'src.utils.file_diff' from '/home/sanddroid/afae/src/utils/file_diff.py'>¶
gather()¶

Gathers changed files and filters out new files.

Raises:

  • FileNotFoundError: If a file is not found during processing.

logger = 'changedFiles'¶
pretty_print()¶

Returns a formatted string of the changed files and their diffs.

Returns:

  • str: A formatted string of the changed files and their diffs.

process_data()¶

Processes the gathered data to filter out noise and whitelist files.

Returns:

  • list: A list of files that are in all lists and not in the noise list.

return_data()¶

Returns a dictionary with the changed files and their diffs.

Returns:

  • dict: A dictionary with the key “Changed Files” and a list of changed files and their diffs.

datagather module¶

class src.datagather.datagather.DataGather¶

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for all modules that perform some data gathering.

Methods:

  • gather(): Abstract method to gather data.

  • return_data(): Abstract method to return gathered data.

  • pretty_print(): Abstract method to pretty print the gathered data.

abstract gather()¶

Gather data.

Raises:

  • NotImplementedError: If the method is not implemented in a subclass.

abstract pretty_print()¶

Pretty print the gathered data.

Raises:

  • NotImplementedError: If the method is not implemented in a subclass.

abstract return_data()¶

Return gathered data.

Returns:

  • Any: The gathered data.

Raises:

  • NotImplementedError: If the method is not implemented in a subclass.

class src.datagather.deletedfiles.DeletedFiles¶

Bases: DataGather

Class for gathering and processing information on deleted files.

Inherits from DataGather and provides methods to gather, process, and display information about deleted files.

deletedFileListList = []¶
gather()¶

Gather information on deleted files.

This method pulls the entire filesystem and compares it to the baseline to identify deleted files.

logger = 'DeletedFiles'¶
pretty_print()¶

Pretty print the list of deleted files.

Returns:

A formatted string with the list of deleted files highlighted.

Return type:

str

process_data()¶

Process the gathered data to filter out noise and identify consistently deleted files.

Returns:

A list of files that have been consistently deleted across all pulls.

Return type:

list

return_data()¶

Return processed data on deleted files.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the list of deleted files.

Return type:

dict

malwaremonitor module¶

class src.datagather.malwaremonitor.MalwareMonitor¶

Bases: DataGather

This class monitors provides a wrapper for the androidmalwaremotionmonitor package to implement it into Sandroid.

Note

Inherits from DataGather.

Attributes:

  • logger (Logger): Logger instance for the class.

  • last_results (dict): Stores the last results of the monitoring.

  • job_manager (JobManager): Manages Frida jobs.

  • process_session (Session): Current Frida process session.

  • app_package (str): Package name of the application being monitored.

  • profiler (AppProfiler): Instance of the AppProfiler class.

  • frida_script_path (str): Path to the Frida script.

  • running (bool): Indicates if the monitoring is currently running.

  • last_output (str): Stores the last output of the profiling.

  • has_new_results (bool): Indicates if there are new results available.

app_package = None¶
frida_script_path = '/home/sanddroid/.local/lib/python3.11/site-packages/androidmalwaremotionmonitor/profiling.js'¶
gather()¶

Gather data from the monitored application.

Warning

Context dependent behavior: Calling this method acts as a toggle, it starts or stops the monitoring process based on the current state.

has_new_results()¶

Check if there are new results available.

Returns:

True if there are new results, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

last_output = None¶
last_results = {}¶
logger = 'MalwareMonitor'¶
pretty_print()¶

Not implemented

profiler = <androidmalwaremotionmonitor.appProfiling.AppProfiler object>¶
return_data()¶

Return the last profiling data.

This method returns the last profiling data and resets the new results flag.

Returns:

The last profiling data in JSON format.

Return type:

str

running = False¶

network module¶

class src.datagather.network.Network¶

Bases: DataGather

Handles network traffic measurement and analysis.

Attributes:

internal_run_counter (int): Counter for internal runs. connections_made (None): Placeholder for connections made. dns_requests (set): Set of DNS requests. logger (Logger): Logger instance for the class. _path (str): Path for storing network trace files. _emulator_path (str): Path on the emulator for storing trace files. _trace_file_name (str): Base name for trace files. performed_diff (bool): Flag indicating if the diff has been performed.

connections_made = None¶
count_bytes(ip_address, port, pcap_file)¶

Internal helper function that counts how many bytes were sent from and to an IP address on a specified port

Parameters:

  • ip_address (str) – IP address to investigate

  • port (int) – port to investigate

  • pcap_file (str) – pcap file to take information from

Returns:

Number of bytes sent

Return type:

int

Returns:

Number of bytes received

Return type:

int

dns_requests = {}¶
extract_dns_requests_for_all_pcaps()¶

Extracts DNS requests from a series of PCAP files and compares them against a ‘noise’ PCAP file to identify unique DNS requests.

Returns:

A list of unique DNS requests found in the PCAP files excluding those found in the ‘noise’ PCAP.

Return type:

list

classmethod extract_dns_requests_from_pcap(pcap_path)¶

Extracts all requested domain names from a PCAP file.

Parameters:

pcap_path – Path to the PCAP file

Returns:

A set of domain names.

Return type:

set

classmethod extract_target_ips_and_ports(pcap_path)¶

Extract all target IPs and ports from a pcap file.

Parameters:

pcap_path (str) – Path to the pcap file.

Returns:

A set of target IPs and ports in the format “IP:Port”.

Return type:

set

extract_target_ips_and_ports_for_all_pcaps()¶

Extracts target IPs and ports from a series of PCAP files and compares them against a ‘noise’ PCAP file to identify unique target IPs and ports.

Returns:

A set of unique target IPs and ports found in the PCAP files excluding those found in the ‘noise’ PCAP.

Return type:

set
